contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Mayor | image = | honorific-prefix = Mayor | name = John Easton Mills | honorific-suffix = | caption = | order = 5th [[Mayor of Montreal]] | term_start = 1846 | term_end = 1847 | constituency = | predecessor = [[James Ferrier]] | successor = [[Joseph Bourret]] | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | constituency2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | birth_date = 14 October 1796 | birth_place = [[Tolland, Massachusetts]], [[United States]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1847|11|12|1796|10|14}} | death_place = [[Montreal]], [[Lower Canada]] | party = Reformist | alma_mater = | spouse = | profession = businessman | religion = | signature = | footnotes = }} '''John Easton Mills''' (October 1796 – November 12, 1847) served briefly as [[mayor of Montreal]], [[Quebec]]. In March 1846, Montreal city council deadlocked on the choice of a mayor. Mills had ten votes, and incumbent mayor [[James Ferrier (Canadian senator)|James Ferrier]] had nine, but Ferrier voted for himself twice, in accordance with existing rules. Municipal paralysis ensued until December 1846, when Mills was elected decisively. ==Typhus outbreak== {{Main|Goose Village, Montreal#Typhus epidemic}} In 1847 there was a major outbreak of [[typhus]] in Montreal among [[Ireland|Irish]] immigrants. Mills organized measures to contain the epidemic and volunteered to tend to the sick, whereupon he contracted the disease himself and died after less than one year in office.<ref name="Bruemmer">{{cite news|url=http://montrealnewsinfo.blogspot.com/2009/05/seeking-hope-they-found-death.html|title=Seeking hope, they found death|last=Bruemmer|first=Rene|date=2009-05-30|work=Montreal Gazette|publisher=Canwest|accessdate=2009-05-30}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Mayors of Montreal}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Mills, John Easton | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =1796-10-14 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Tolland, Massachusetts]], [[United States]] | DATE OF DEATH =1847-11-12 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Montreal]], [[Lower Canada]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mills, John Easton}} [[Category:Mayors of Montreal]] [[Category:1796 births]] [[Category:1847 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:Deaths from typhus]] [[Category:Infectious disease deaths in Quebec]] [[Category:People from Hampden County, Massachusetts]] [[Category:Anglophone Quebec people]] {{Quebec-mayor-stub}}
